quest.description:
First off, let me introduce myself. I'm Scar, second-in-command of the Flaming Fist.
I need you to begin an investigation of the Seven Suns trading coster. The Seven Suns leadership has been acting strangely of late. They've been selling off valuable assets and neglecting many of their more profitable trading ventures. Considering the importance that the trading coster holds over the economy of the city, the Grand Dukes are noticeably upset. I've gone to talk to the coster's head, Jhasso. He rudely rebuffed me, telling me to mind my own business. I've known Jhasso for many years, and this isn't his usual behavior. I can't start up an official investigation, as there is no real reason for doing so. That's why I need you.
I want you to break into the Seven Suns compound and find out what's wrong. Use stealth in your investigations; I don't want this operation to cause too much fuss. The most important person to watch for is Jhasso.
Once you've found out as much as possible, report back to me at the Flaming Fist compound.
I'll pay you 2,000 gold for this favor.

quest.description:
As a cleric, my duty is to heal the villagers of Woodland Homestead both spiritually and physically. As a hero, your duty is to help people in trouble.
I sometimes devise new treatments for various illnesses: some of my experiments are successful, the others, sadly, not so much. I would like you to assist me with an experiment. I also have a volunteer participating in the experiment as well: a depressed man from this very village.
I need you to go to the Desolate Plains, the desert just outside this village, and hit that test subject of mine with lightning when there's a thunderstorm. For this, I'm giving you an enchanted trident: you can use it to channel lightning during thunderstorms.
Finally, you should report back to me, and let me know what happened. You can keep the trident.
May the Gods be with you, hero!

Have you heard of the Briarhearts? They are fierce warriors of the Forsworn tribes. They actually remove their own hearts, and replace them with large briar seeds. It puts their lifesparks in direct connection to the natural forces.
Well, I'm hoping to do something similar... if I could connect a living being to the forces of nature... well... that would be formidable. I've done some experiments in this area, but, well, my test subjects are far too fragile. I'm hoping to learn some of the Briarheart techniques, their methods.
I need you to examine one of them. Just investigate as much as you can. The Forsworn live in the hills on the western edge of Skyrim. From there, you're on your own. I'm given to understand that they are not difficult to find, if you gather my inference.

quest.description:
Please... I implore you, help me, Corrick Northwode, avenge my wife's death!
Barely a week ago, I left Harm's Folly to go buy supplies as I usually do once a month. What a fool I was to leave my wife alone. The goblins must have been watching me, as they knew right when to strike. I could hear her screams from far away. Those wretched beasts killed her! Filthy animals! Had I only been there to stop them!
I'll tell you how you can help. Go to Exhausted Mine. Kill those goblins. Every last one of them! They destroyed everything I hold dear! In their greed, the creatures grabbed a jade amulet off of Kayleen's... body. Bring me back that amulet, so I may use it to remember her by.
Please, I'll give you six gems as a token of my gratitude. They're all I have left of value, but you must have them if you do the deed.

Just think what moist jungle air is doing to that precious tome of forgotten knowledge! I need to find it, and collect it for me. I can't leave the village myself; no one else can tend my library!

Go at night, and you will find my present guard captain there already, a woman by the name of Mook. Take note of anything odd that happens.
Good hunting. Report to me if anything happens. Oh, and the reward I have set aside for you... I'll let you have some magical items. You will find them useful, I am sure.

quest.description:
Ah Potema, the Wolf Queen. Former queen of Solitude and one of the most dangerous necromancers in recorded history. She was responsible for the Empire's near collapse almost five hundred years ago. I believe I have a book about her...
And now Potema has been summoned in spirit form. Summoned in spirit form is not raised from the dead. She'll need help before she can return to the living.
For the moment, the Wolf Queen has retreated to a place filled with dead eager to serve her. She has gone to her old Catacombs. A few days ago, one of her servants busted through a wall into the Temple of Divines. We'll need you to go into the Catacombs themselves.
You were there when Potema was summoned. Being at the summoning created a connection to Potema, you are the one to stop her from returning to the living. I can provide you with some help with her minions.
As to Potema herself, find what's left of her body, likely a skeleton. Remove it from the Catacombs and bring it back to be sanctified by Arkay.

Those Sturmbeorn seem to be working from schematics, but they keep them under lock and key. Do you think you might be able to get in there and grab the armor schematics?

TESO363: the mistress of shadows, one of the Daedric Princes

plots: the Eye was stolen from its shrine and hid in dark waters

quest.title: Nocturnal's Missing Eye

recover Nocturnal's Eye from Argonians

quest.description:
Night among strangers. Secrets in the dark. Nocturnal is here.
But my Eye is blind and drowned, stolen from its shrine, and hid in dark waters. To steal from a god is most unwise. In Leyawiin, two Argonians think themselves secret, but the Eye has seen them.
Find these thieves in the city that spans the waters. Learn where they hide my Eye. Retrieve the Eye of Nocturnal, mortal, and return it to me, and I shall look favorably upon you.
You, mortal, may take this Skeleton Key upon your return. It shall open the secrets of dark places for you.

plots: Feran Sadri gives the player Dawnguard armor, and a note for framing the Dawnguard

quest.title: Deceiving the Herd
quest.objective: frame the Dawnguard for murder

murder someone influential in public while wearing Dawnguard armor and plant a note on the victim
frame the Dawnguard for murder
quest.description:
The Dawnguard have increased their operations and have been aggressively recruiting in Whiterun.
We need to put a damper on their efforts and give those trouble makers something to worry about other than harassing our interests.
You are to make a public show of murdering someone. Do it in the streets for all to see. The higher the profile the better. Someone attached to the court, a merchant, a bard, a priest, someone with stature. Make it seem you are a member of the Dawnguard, thus sowing confusion among the herd. Wear this armor and plant this note on the victim.
The people will put pressure on the Dawnguard who are apparently murdering their fellows without provocation. Their focus will be shifted from us, giving us one less nuisance to deal with.

plots: Madesi is one of the few traditional Saxhleel jewelers that remain in Tamriel

quest.objective: gather jewelry materials for Madesi

gather jewelry materials for Madesi
quest.description:
I make my own jewelry. Sadly, I'm one of the few traditional Saxhleel jewelers that remains in Tamriel; it's becoming a lost art. Only trouble is gathering materials has become hazardous. The roads to the mines and to the other cities are thick with bandits... and worse.
Would you be interested in gathering some materials for me? I'd certainly be happy to compensate you. I'm seeking a small list of items to complete my next creation: two flawless sapphires, a mammoth tusk and a chunk of gold ore.

MC128: a sunken ship east of Seaside Settlement
MC129: a sunken ship east of Seaside Settlement
a sunken ship east of Seaside Settlement

plots: Kitt wants serenity
the player a friend of Kitt

quest.objective: recover a bundle of potion ingredients for Kitt
tasks: Go to .
find the bundle of potion ingredients
recover a bundle of potion ingredients for Kitt
quest.description:
The ship sank. All those poor sailors have now passed the veil to the other side. This is a sad day for us all.
My friend, that ship carried important potion ingredient for our village. Most of the goods that are not produced here are transported here by the sea. Now I can't fashion remedies for our villagers, and the next shipment will not be here for a long time.
You are a good person. I ask you to find a bundle of life-saving potion ingredients for me. That would mean a lot for the whole village! The bundle should be in the sunken ship east of here. Here, this potion of water breathing should help you dive to the ship save and sound.
I'll even let you have my old, extra brewing stand as a gift upon your return. Be careful while you dive; there a many lethal things lurking beneath the waves. I'd hate to bury a friend.

TESO452: one of the guild hall leaders of the Mages Guild
each local guild hall in Cyrodiil

TESO453: each local guild hall in Cyrodiil

plots: the player wants to join the Mages Guild: Carahil makes the player an Associate of the Mages Guild
all recommendations must be sent to the Council of Mages before the player can enter the Arcane University

advance in the Mages Guild
quest.description:
Hello there. Is there something with which I can assist you? Perhaps you're curious about joining the Mages Guild?
All right, then. You're now an Associate of the Mages Guild. Congratulations! You'll need to receive a recommendation from each local guild hall in Cyrodiil to advance in the guild, and be given any sort of responsibility. They can be done in any order, but they all must be sent in to the Council before you can enter the Arcane University.

TESO343: a ruined fort far to the west of the Imperial City, and Agronak gro-Malog's birthplace
TESO344: a nobleman, and Agronak gro-Malog's father
TESO345: a noblewoman, the wife of Lord Lovidicus

plots: Agronak gro-Malog's mother fled with Agronak gro-Malog from the wrath of Lady Lovidicus
Agronak gro-Malog's mother gave Agronak gro-Malog a key to Crowhaven to "unlock the truth" before dying

quest.title: Origin of the Gray Prince
quest.objective: find proof of Agronak gro-Malog's noble birthright
tasks: Go to Crowhaven.
travel to the place of Agronak gro-Malog's birth
find proof of Agronak gro-Malog's noble birthright
quest.description:
Hail, friend. I don't believe I've ever seen you down here in the Bloodworks before. Allow me to introduce myself. My name is Agronak gro-Malog.
I grew up here in the Imperial City, but I was born elsewhere. My mother was a servant in the employ of Lord Lovidicus, and resided at his fortress. Lady Lovidicus was a shrew of a woman. The Lord and my mother grew close, and ultimately fell in love. I was the result of their union. When the Lady learned of my birth she was furious, and threatened to kill both my mother and me. So we fled, leaving my claim to nobility behind.
My mother died recently. Before she passed, she gave me this key, and told me it would "unlock the truth," at the place of my birth, Crowhaven. Crowhaven is a ruined fort far to the west of here. I'd go myself, but my training regiment doesn't allow for the luxury of such an excursion.
My friend, you must travel to Crowhaven and use the key to unlock whatever it is that holds the proof of my birthright! Find this proof and return it to me, and I'll share with you some of my finest combat techniques. Trust me, you can't learn these moves in a book!

TESO172: a district of a big city

plots: Ahjazda is the only one who sees the approaching storm

quest.title: The Coming Storm
quest.objective: help Ahjazda prepare for the coming storm
tasks: bring the Amulet of Disintegration, the Ring of Desiccation, and the Calming Pants to Ahjazda
help Ahjazda prepare for the coming storm
quest.description:
So much to gather, so little time. Perhaps you can help? You might help against the coming storm.
It's coming. I, Ahjazda, think I'm the only one who sees it, though. And I'm going to be ready. Oh, yes. I'll be ready. I've been stockpiling supplies. Things I'll need to ride it out... or survive when they come for me.
I've been gathering things for quite a while, but there are still a few I'm missing. Perhaps you'd bring them to me? I still need the Amulet of Disintegration, the Ring of Desiccation, and, of course, the Calming Pants. Must have the Calming Pants. Bring these to me, and I will reward you well. Ahjazda has many, many things.
Let me teach you a special spell, Ahjazda's Paranoia, after you return with the items. It will affect all those around you. You might find it handy to cause confusion in your enemies. You know... when the time comes.

TESO263: the male captain of the Bruma guard

plots: the player taught Captain Burd and his guardsmen how to close Oblivion Gates: however, they cannot defend Bruma alone from the innumerable Daedra of Oblivion

quest.title: Allies for Bruma
quest.objective: bring in reinforcements for Bruma from the other cities of Cyrodiil and the Elder Council before the Mythic Dawn opens a Great Oblivion Gate in Bruma
tasks: speak to the leaders of the other cities of Cyrodiil and the Elder Council and ask them to send help to Bruma
bring in reinforcements for Bruma from the other cities of Cyrodiil and the Elder Council before the Mythic Dawn opens a Great Oblivion Gate in Bruma
quest.description:
Good work. Captain Burd and his guardsmen should be able to handle any additional Gates, at least for now. But the Bruma Guard cannot defend the city indefinitely. The Daedra of Oblivion are innumerable; the guardsmen of Bruma are not.
We need to gather what allies we can before Bruma is hopelessly besieged. If the Mythic Dawn manages to open a Great Gate here, the city will need a stronger garrison for there to be any hope of defending it.
You should speak to the rulers of the other cities of Cyrodiil, as well as the Elder Council. Ask them to send aid to Bruma before it is too late.

TESO56: the prince of madness, one of the Daedric Princes

plots: the Greymarch has swept the Fringe

help Sheogorath's armies to retake the Fringe from the forces of Order

quest.description:
The Greymarch has swept the Fringe. Order gathers its forces there as we speak. And I hate when people gather forces in My Fringe. You'll need to put an end to that. Stop them.
My armies should already be there, but I want you to see what you can do to help. If they continue to marshal their forces there, we won't be able to contain them. Make sure they can't.

TESS534: a tower hosting a bandit hideout

plots: the player stumbled upon Christer while exploring Mistwatch
Christer heard that bandits in Mistwatch ransom captives and thinks that Fjola might be one of them: he managed to sneak in and look for Fjola, but he is not a warrior

quest.title: Mistwatch
quest.objective: help Christer locate Fjola
tasks: look for Fjola
help Christer locate Fjola
quest.description:
Please, stranger! I need your help! Divine mercy - you aren't one of the bandits. Please, you've got to help me!
It's my wife, Fjola! I think she's being held in this tower. Let me explain. Fjola, my wife, left the farm on errands and never came back. It's been months, and I've been searching for her since. I heard a rumor that these bandits were ransoming captives, so I thought she may be here. I managed to sneak past the guards and get this far, but... I don't think I can go on. I'm no warrior! Please, can you look for her?
I don't have much, but I can give you some coin for the trouble. One of the guards dropped this key while I hid. I wager it will come in handy for you. Please hurry!

TESS582: Jaree-Ra's sister, a female treasure hunter

plots: Jaree-Ra and Deeja collect things nobody misses
with the war, many more ships come through Solitude Docks loaded with weapons and pay, but few people

quest.title: Lights Out!
quest.objective: help run the Icerunner aground
tasks: Go to Solitude Lighthouse.
put out the lighthouse fire
meet Jaree-Ra
help run the Icerunner aground
quest.description:
It's easy to find things to sell. Things nobody will miss. Things from underground, or just left lying around in someone's house. I bet the two of us, we're very alike. So why not take the next step? We can help each other.
My sister Deeja and I are treasure hunters. You could be too. We like to collect things. We are not thieves. We just take what will not be missed. What no one needs anymore. Maybe we take some weapons and stop a few deaths. Who would call that thievery?
With the war, many more ships come through these docks. Loaded with weapons and pay, but few people. And they pass through dangerous waters. We have an interest in one of those boats, the Icerunner. The Solitude Lighthouse will be guiding it in... but if its fire were to go out, the Icerunner would run aground.
If someone were to put out the lighthouse fire and then meet me on the docks afterwards... I could certainly direct them to that loot. That someone could be you.

plots: many have tried to survive the Arena of Slaughter: now their souls serve Grom

quest.title: Grom's Arena
quest.objective: prove your worth to Grom
tasks: attempt to survive the Arena of Slaughter
prove your worth to Grom
quest.description:
So... you come seeking the wealth of Grom? My spoils are vast, and have no peer in this realm.
There is no path to success for you, lest you survive my arena and prove your worth.
Be forewarned - many have tested their mettle on this bloodstained floor, but none have yet succeeded. Their souls are now mine, and they do as they are bid.
Will you attempt the challenge? I will await your decision.
None have yet triumphed within the walls of my arena.
Perhaps you will be the first?
Perhaps...

plots: the player looks at the Dwemer lockbox with Septimus Signus
Dwemer blood can unlock the Dwemer lockbox: the blood of Altmer, Bosmer, Dunmer, Falmer, and Orsimer, can be used instead

quest.title: Discerning the Transmundane
quest.objective: uncover the secrets of the mysterious Dwemer lockbox with Septimus Signus
tasks: gather the blood of Altmer, Bosmer, Dunmer, Falmer, and Orsimer with an extractor Septimus Signus gives you
uncover the secrets of the mysterious Dwemer lockbox with Septimus Signus
quest.description:
You see this masterwork of the Dwemer. Deep inside their greatest knowings. Septimus is clever among men, but he is but an idiot child compared to the dullest of the Dwemer.
To harness it is to know. The fundaments. The Dwemer lockbox hides it from me. I see it now. The sealing structure interlocks in the tiniest fractals. Dwemer blood can loose the hooks, but none alive remain to bear it. A panoply of their brethren could gather to form a facsimile. A trick. Something they didn't anticipate, no, not even them.
The blood of Altmer, Bosmer, Dunmer, Falmer, and Orsimer. The elves still living provide the key. Bear you hence this extractor. It will drink the fresh blood of elves. Come when its set is complete.

Greetings, we are Minsc and Boo. Boo is my faithful hamster companion, and more than he seems.
We have traveled far to explore this land, but now my charge Dynaheir has been taken from us. 'Twas gnolls, and once we have tracked them I will beat sense into their heads until they release her.
Accompany us, and bards will sing the deeds of Minsc and Boo... and friends.
Onward to the gnoll stronghold in the west!

TESS140: a forefather of Roggi Knot-Beard who lost the Knot-Beard shield

retrieve the Knot-Beard shield for Roggi Knot-Beard
quest.description:
I'm from from here. I've wandered a bit, but I always come back to Kynesgrove. My clan was one of the first to settle here.
Legend says that my forefather Lenne discovered the mines after he stumbled into a dark cave to relieve himself. Too much mead. Of course, there's another story of Lenne losing the family shield in a different cave, so it depends on who you believe.
According to my grandfather at least, the family shield should be in the cave. He swore that version of the legend was true, even found the cave old Lenne stumbled into: Ansilvund. Hey, if you find it, I could show you some of the clan's favorite fighting moves. They're all shield techniques.

TESS248: the nobleman who rules over Whiterun

TESS374: the man leading the other side of the war

plots: the player asked Balgruuf the Greater to help the player trap a dragon in Whiterun: Ulfric and General Tullius want to capture Whiterun
getting both sides of war to agree to a truce will be difficult at this point

quest.title: Season Unending
quest.objective: negotiate a truce between Ulfric and General Tullius
tasks: Go to High Hrothgar.
ask the Greybeards hold a peace council
negotiate a truce between Ulfric and General Tullius
quest.description:
I want to help you, Dragonborn. And I will. But I need your help first.
Ulfric and General Tullius are both just waiting for me to make a wrong move. Do you think they will sit idle while a dragon is slaughtering my men and burning my city? No. I can't risk weakening the city while we are under the threat of enemy attack. I'm sorry.
If only you could negotiate a truce between Ulfric and General Tullius. Then I would be glad to help you with your mad dragon-trapping scheme. But getting both sides to agree to a truce will be difficult at this point. The bitterness has gone too deep. Maybe... hmm... what of the Greybeards? They are respected by everyone. High Hrothgar is neutral territory. If the Greybeards were willing to host a peace council... then maybe Ulfric and Tullius would have to listen.

TESS62: the player's commanding officer in the Stormcloaks, a Nord
TESS52: a city with tall, yet old and crumbling walls

plots: Galmar Stone-Fist is addressing the player and the player's fellow Stormcloaks: the true sons and daughters of Skyrim

quest.title: Storm over Whiterun

tasks: Go to Whiterun.
tear through the barricades, and find a way to drop the drawbridge into Whiterun
take Whiterun in the name of the Stormcloaks
quest.description:
This is it men! They say that our cause is false and that we are nothing more than thieves, thugs and murderers! But no! We are farmers! We are craftsmen! We are sons and daughters of shopkeepers, maid servants and soldiers!
We are the sons and daughters of Skyrim! And we have come this far because our cause is true. Because we fight as one. And because our hearts are bursting with anger! What we do here today, we do for our country! For all the true Nords of Skyrim!
Whiterun's walls are tall, but they are old and crumbling, like the Empire whose Legion lines them. They've barricades to block us, but we'll tear through them and the Imperials behind them! Our objective is the drawbridge. If we can find a way to drop it, the city will be ours!
Everyone on me. Let's show these Imperial milk drinkers what true Nords look like! Rrrrraaaaaarrrrr!!!!!

TESS391: a small cottage, and a bandit hideout

plots: the player is a member of the Thieves Guild

quest.title: Silver Lining
quest.objective: recover Endon's stolen silver mold for him

find Endon's stolen silver mold
recover Endon's stolen silver mold for him
quest.description:
Several months ago I ordered a special silver mold from some artisans in Valenwood. Well, it never arrived. Later I found out that it was robbed by a group of bandits led by someone named Rigel Strong-Arm.
Look, I talked to everyone with an ounce of authority... everyone. They all told me their resources were spread too thin right now. Word on the street says that the Thieves Guild is coming back into its own in Markarth so I figured... ...to send a thief to steal back what was stolen.
Look, this mold is irreplaceable. I'll pay you well for its return and I can also prove to be quite a valuable ally to the Thieves Guild.  The only thing I can tell you is that the mold was taken to the bandit's hideout... a small cottage called Pinewatch.
I'm not sure how many men they have inside, but I trust that won't be an issue for you. Good luck.

TESS2: an abandoned fort in the Reach

an abandoned fort in the Reach

prevent the Dawnguard from becoming a serious threat against the vampires
quest.description:
The Dawnguard will, no doubt, soon become even more of a nuisance now that Auriel's Bow has been recovered.
We need to strike a crippling blow against them before they muster more men against us. They've holed up in an abandoned fort in the Reach. The Dawnguard are apparently focused on exterminating vampires, noble and brute alike. Not a serious threat, but we can't leave them completely unchecked or they may become one.
But their time has come to an end. And you will be the one that ends it. Killing their leaders should discourage them from an out and out war with us.

MC140: an ancient desert pyramid filled with traps and treasure, a short way away from Desert Refuge

bring an ancient device to Zed
quest.description:
Hello traveler. What brings you to Desert Refuge, this piece of civilization out in the scorching desert? Are you stocking up on supplies on your way to explore desert ruins?
If you are, I would like your help. I promise to pay you with something useful. The thing is, there's this ancient pyramid, Tut's Temple, a short way away from this village. It is said to be full of treasure! And some highly lethal traps that are too much to overcome for a meager researcher like me. There are also rumors that say that the ancients had useful devices lost to time. I'd love to get my hands on one, for science.
Please, go to Tut's Temple and find an ancient device! It may tell us about many lost crafts!

plots: the cloak is an important symbol of old times

fetch the cloak
bring the cloak to Delainy

No doubt you felt the storm that passed just by and by? Village-home did as well, and the cloak that draped the village center was cast to the wind. I think it is beyond the wall, and will not risk the beasts to get it. Will you?
I can offer little besides my gratitude. The cloak is a keepsake, a symbol of old times.

TESS240: a long forsaken cave to the west of Windhelm

Luckily for you, I've already made the required mixture. Here, take it. Please... don't dally. I've wasted enough time arguing with my useless assistant here.

Just so it happens, I'm running low on diamonds: soon I can't make any diamond swords for daring adventurers. I'm not skilled in adventuring; I can't brave the deep underground for diamond veins.
Yet, I have a whopping block of Netherite. You definitely don't see those every day! Here's the deal: bring me 2 blocks of diamond, and I'll give you my block of Netherite. A good deal for a good friend.

TESS507: the god of infection and pestilence

There is a way Peryite may speak to us who will take Him in. If you wish to commune with Him, we'll need the incense. Fetch for me a deathbell flower, one silver ingot, a flawless ruby, and some vampire dust. Then I will show you how.
How to gather the ingredients? This one would try a shop. You might prefer the direct route, hm? Deathbell grow in the frozen tundra. You might nip into a mine for the ruby and silver. Vampire Dust is tricky. Vampires, you know.

TESO159: the player's superior in the Fighters Guild

plots: Modryn Oreyn has been investigating the Blackwood Company: they are a danger to the Fighters Guild
the Fighters Guild was contracted by Argoth to recover an artifact from Azani Blackheart: Modryn Oreyn went in there with twenty good men, and left with five

quest.title: Azani Blackheart
quest.objective: help Modryn Oreyn prove that the Blackwood Company lied about completing a contract for Argoth
tasks: Go to Arpenia.
meet up with Modryn Oreyn
investigate Arpenia with Modryn Oreyn
help Modryn Oreyn prove that the Blackwood Company lied about completing a contract for Argoth
quest.description:
Good. You're here. We've got duties to attend to.
I've been looking into the Blackwood Company. Heard some disturbing things. We know they're a danger to us. And we know they're good at what they do.
I've heard stories, but nothing I can prove is true. Maybe they've got a mage working with them. Maybe they're just well trained. All I know for sure is that they'll accept any contract, and they'll do anything to complete it. And they don't care who gets in the way.
We were contracted by a wizard, Argoth, to recover an artifact from Azani Blackheart, a ruthless bandit leader. I went in there with twenty men. I left with five. Vitellus Donton wasn't one of them. He died covering our retreat. I snooped around. Apparently, the Blackwood Company completed that contract for us. I went in there with twenty good men. I can't believe that bunch finished the job. There's more. Argoth -- he's dead, the artifact gone. Sounds like a set-up. Maybe they made a deal with Blackheart. I don't know. But I'll find out.
Now we find out what really happened. And we let it be known. I want to show the people who the Blackwood Company really are. I can't order you do this with me. It's dangerous, and Vilena Donton isn't going to know about it. It's your choice.
If you accept this mission, we leave as soon as you're ready. I want to investigate Blackheart's stronghold at Arpenia. Meet me at the Leyawiin guild hall. We'll go from there.

quest.description:
Dear sibling. I've been waiting for you. Your next contract awaits, as I'm sure Astrid indicated.
With the Emperor's arrival in Skyrim now a certainty, his security service, the Penitus Oculatus, will need to begin its preparations immediately. Security is being handled by a Commander Maro. Astrid and I have devised a plan to break the man, and in doing so, cripple the Emperor's protection.
You are to slay the commander's son, Gaius Maro, and once he is dead, plant false evidence on his body implicating him in a plot to kill the Emperor. He is set to leave the Penitus Oculatus outpost at Dragon Bridge, and inspect the security of each city in Skyrim. Go there now. Observe Gaius Maro's departure, and follow him. Waylay him in one of the cities, and send his soul to Sithis. Once he's dead, plant the incriminating letter on his body, and let fate take care of the rest. Oh, and one final thing...
To earn your bonus, do not kill Gaius Maro in Dragon Bridge, or on the road. Kill him in one of the other major cities he'll be visiting. There, the body will be discovered quickly, as will the letter implicating Gaius Maro in the plot to assassinate the Emperor. Do that, and Astrid has authorized me to grant you a rather unique bonus. It is a special token, to be given to Olava the Feeble, in Whiterun. Olava is an old and dear friend, and a powerful seer. The token entitles you to a reading of your future. It's an opportunity one should not pass up.

quest.description:
Long Forgotten Note
by Daravyn the Gray

My love,
I write this with trembling hands. The guards are after me, and I have nowhere else to turn. Soon they will be at the doors to Rosethorn Hall, and nothing will keep them from taking me away back to that horrible prison. I don't know how they found me; perhaps it was that traitor, Delgariun. Whoever told them I was hiding in your home must have known both of us very well. I know Delgariun has eyes for you, I know he's the one that framed me in the first place and had me sent to that dank hole in the Imperial City. He has to be the one. Beware of him, my love. He's treacherous and only wants you to get to the treasure. I didn't give it up to the guards, and I won't give it up to Delgariun. I've hidden the treasure within the walls of Rosethorn Hall. Remember the toy we played with as we ran through this place as children?
Remember the riddle we had for it? It was our secret code: "Two bodies have I, though both joined in one. The more I stand still, the quicker I run."
The key to the treasure lies with the answer. Take care of it, my love. It is your ticket far from Delgariun. Do not fret, I've escaped once, I shall do so again. Soon we will be together, and the sun will shine upon us.
Daravyn the Gray

Bandit Leader's Journal

5th of First Seed, 4E 201
Idiots! Brodir and Herd were at each others' throats again today, and nearly came to blows. The whole camp is on edge. I've ordered an extra ration of mead, but unless this fighting stops, we'll tear ourselves apart.

11th of First Seed, 4E 201
Rumor is that Herd's gathering followers for a mutiny. Brodir's not stupid; he's probably doing the same, just for insurance. I'd kill them both myself, but the camp's split right down the middle. If I tried, there'd be a knife in my back within a week.
I can't take this anymore. I've begun skimming a little gold from the take, bringing it down here when I can. If I can scrape enough together, I'll make a run for it, head downriver to Dragon Bridge.

28th of First Seed, 4E 201
Brodir's getting suspicious -- I caught him poking around in the cove this afternoon. I don't think he found my stash, but it's not safe here. I took the boat out tonight and stowed it on the island to the south, by the old tree stump.
Had a good haul this week. Another caravan or two and I can finally get out of here, and not a moment too soon.

quest.objective: deliver a sensitive intelligence message for General Tullius
tasks: Go to Whiterun.
deliver the message to Jarl Baalgruf
deliver a sensitive intelligence message for General Tullius
quest.description:
I need someone I can trust to deliver a message of great import to Jarl Baalgruf of Whiterun.
We have it on good authority that Ulfric has raised enough men to attack the city of Whiterun. The Jarl, however, refuses the Legion's support. This missive should convince him.
Be aware soldier, these documents contain sensitive intelligence for the Jarl's eyes only.

plots: thieves broke into the Bards College and made off with a lot of valuable things: Finn's Lute included
Finn invented the eight course lute that is commonplace today

quest.title: Finn's Lute
quest.objective: return Finn's Lute to Inge Six Fingers
tasks: Go to Stony Creek Cave.
find Finn's Lute
return Finn's Lute to Inge Six Fingers
quest.description:
Hmm? Oh, sorry. My mind wanders sometimes. I was just thinking about Finn's Lute.
Over a year ago, thieves broke into the College and made off with a lot of valuable things. Mostly gold and silver. But they also stole Finn's Lute. We just learned where the bandits fled to, and I very much want that lute back. They are at Stony Creek Cave.
Finn was the bard who invented the eight course lute that is commonplace today. Until he found a way to string the extra courses, bards only had six course lutes. The lute they stole is Finn's original eight course lute. I doubt they even realize its true value.
There is no way I can pay you what this Lute is worth. But I can teach you a few tricks I've learned over the years.

plots: Fuller knows the player

quest.title: An Errand for Fuller
quest.objective: bring a quarrel of crossbow bolts to Fuller
tasks: Go to Candlekeep Inn.
buy crossbow bolts from Winthrop
bring a quarrel of crossbow bolts to Fuller
quest.description:
Hey kid, it's me, Fuller.
I need a quarrel of crossbow bolts. If you could get some off Winthrop at the inn, I'll reimburse you. there'll be a dagger in it for you too. My father killed a hobgoblin with it once, many years ago. Stabbed him right in the back, he did. It ain't no broadsword, but it'll do in a pinch.

TESO181: the lord of monsters, one of the Daedric Princes

plots: Lord Drad took Malacath's ogres: ogres are Malacath's little brothers

quest.objective: rescue ogres from slavery under Lord Drad
tasks: let Malacath's ogres loose and get them out of Lord Drad's mines
rescue ogres from slavery under Lord Drad
quest.description:
You want something from Malacath? Then, if you're smart, you do what I tell you.
Lord Drad took my ogres. Says he owns them. Lying maggot! They're MY ogres! Lord Drad put my little brothers in chains, working in the mines. I don't like that.
Get over to Lord Drad's estate. Let my ogres loose, and get them out! Okay? Get going!
You get a present, Volendrung. Be nice to my little brothers!

Welcome to the family, kid. I'm expecting you to make us a lot of coin, so don't disappoint me.
This is how you get your cut of the spoils. Do as you're told and keep your blade clean. We can't turn a profit by killing.
You should talk with Delvin Mallory and Vex. They know their way around this place and they'll be able to kick some extra jobs your way.
Oh, and talk to Tonilia in the Flagon... she'll set you up with your new armor.

figure out how to stop the Alchemist
quest.description:
Your arrival is well-timed. I believe I have located the Alchemist's lair, here in the Icedeep Caverns. I found a Journal just inside the entrance; it speaks of entering the mine at Torchlight and retrieving Ordrak's Heart. I intended to look for more, further inside the icy caverns, but the creatures dwelling there now are too much for me.
Finding the rest of the Alchemist's Journals would probably be very helpful in ascertaining how to stop him. The one I saw was volume four, so there are probably three more in the Icedeep Caverns.

BG133: a tower atop untouched dungeons filled with riches

get the ward token that opens the way to the labyrinths beneath Durlag's Tower from Galken
quest.description:
I'm Galken. Hey, how'd you like to be supping on fine venison and tippin' back the good stuff?
I've the key to wealth legendary if you're up for it. No doubt you've heard of the labyrinth at Durlag's Tower, eh? And how she's been pillaged so often that fat nobles go there for picnics? Well, the TOWER has, but BELOW are dungeons untouched! I've a token, a ward token to be sure, that gives entry to them.
'Tis yours if you'll but settle my tab so I can leave this fine place... with all my limbs intact.

TESO79: the legendary male knight who killed Umaril the Unfeathered once before

plots: the player is an embodiment of Pelinal Whitestrake
Umaril the Unfeathered's Daedric nature allows his spirit to escape into Oblivion after death

quest.title: Umaril the Unfeathered
quest.objective: defeat Umaril the Unfeathered and kill him for good, in both the physical and spiritual planes
tasks: Go to Garlas Malatar.
find Umaril the Unfeathered
defeat Umaril the Unfeathered and kill him for good, in both the physical and spiritual planes
quest.description:
Hear my final passings of praise and wisdom!
You have stepped from the humble shadows of obscurity and into legend. No feat you have accomplished in your life compares to what you have become. You are an embodiment of Pelinal Whitestrake, the bane of Umaril the Unfeathered.
The time has come for you to fulfill your destiny. Umaril lies hid in the ancient fane of Garlas Malatar. You must go there and destroy him. Umaril's Daedric nature allows his spirit to escape into Oblivion after death. This is what Pelinal learned upon defeating Umaril the first time. You must first kill his living body. While beyond the power of most mortals, this is only the lesser of your two tasks. It will allow you to follow Umaril into the spirit realm upon his death. It will allow you to destroy him, body and soul, utterly and for all time.

TESO116: the player's superior in the Dark Brotherhood
TESO507: a fort far to the west, nestled in the mountains

plots: Roderick lies in eternal slumber, kept alive only by the daily administration of a powerful medicine

quest.title: Bad Medicine
quest.objective: assassinate Roderick without been seen by his company of loyal mercenaries
tasks: Go to Fort Sutch.
replace Roderick's medicine with a poisoned bottle Ocheeva gives you
assassinate Roderick without been seen by his company of loyal mercenaries
quest.description:
Far to the west there lives a fierce warlord and his company of loyal mercenaries. Your target is the warlord. Do you accept this contract?
Now listen closely. Nestled in the mountains to the west lies Fort Sutch. It is the home of the warlord Roderick and his mercenaries. Roderick has recently taken ill. He now lies in eternal slumber, kept alive only by the daily administration of a powerful medicine.
You must infiltrate Fort Sutch, find Roderick's medicine, and replace it with a poisoned bottle I will provide. But you must remain undetected! Whomever arranged this contract wants it to look like Roderick died from his illness, so discretion is essential. Attack no one! Be seen by no one! If you are detected, the poisoning will fail, and Roderick must be killed in some other manner. That will, of course, forfeit your bonus.
Roderick may lie near death, but dead he is not. Until his soul has passed, our client -- and the Grim Reaper himself -- will not be satisfied.

BG1278: a set of caves to the northeast
BG1279: a set of caves to the northeast
a set of caves to the northeast
BG1280: a set of caves to the northeast

plots: goblins first appeared around the house of an old mage
the old mage was captured by goblins

quest.title: Magreb and Rilsa
quest.objective: avenge Rilsa and give her a proper burial
tasks: find goblins that killed Rilsa
avenge Rilsa and give her a proper burial
quest.description:
Goblins! All I know is they killed Rilsa when she tried to talk to them, and I can't face them by myself. At first they appeared around the house of an old mage, but soon they moved into a set of caves to the northeast, taking him with them.
Forgive me. My name is Magreb. Rilsa and I have watched over this area for years, and we never had any trouble with goblins before. Since they killed her, I've been half out of my mind with grief.
Please avenge my Rilsa and give her a proper burial!

quest.objective: strengthen the barriers between the worlds
tasks: seal the portals to Oblivion
strengthen the barriers between the worlds
quest.description:
Training, child? You would know more about the mystic energies of the world around us?
The barriers between planes are weak. Do more to strengthen them; seal the portals to Oblivion. Then we shall speak of training.

TESO163: Duke of Mania, a Felldew addict
TESO315: a chalice that makes the world a much brighter and happier place after eating Felldew

plots: Thadon is inebriated from withdrawal effects of Felldew

quest.title: Addiction
quest.objective: return the Chalice of Reversal to Thadon
tasks: find the Chalice of Reversal
return the Chalice of Reversal to Thadon
quest.description:
Ahh yes, THERE you are! You couldn't imagine how long I, Thadon, the Duke of Mania, have been waiting for you. So little to do, and so much time. Hmm, could you, in fact, imagine just how long I've been waiting? I don't think you could, but I might be wrong.
It felt like rather a long time, but then long times get longer when you're standing around thinking about them. A curious thing, that. Long roads get longer too, if you're thinking about them, but what about long words? They don't change nearly as much. Long, short -- it all ends up the same. Dust and tears. Usually tears first, then the dust. Dust can't cry, you see. That would be... well, amusing. You know what's NOT amusing? I don't have my Chalice of Reversal. It makes me sad. When I get sad, I don't care to do much of anything. I certainly don't care to help people who show up on my doorstep wanting something. Are we getting the picture here?
The Chalice of Reversal is one of my favorite toys. Does wonders for creativity. Well, not by itself, but it helps. Is this making sense? Look, you eat the Felldew, then use the chalice, and find the world a much brighter and happier place. Honest. But I don't have it. So I can't eat Felldew, because that would just be bad. I mean, really bad. Find my chalice!

TESS196: a fellow member of the Companions
TESS198: the mead hall of the Companions
TESS199: the headquarters of the Silver Hand
TESS200: an old man, and the leader of the Companions

plots: the Silver Hand attacked the Companions in Jorrvaskr, killed Kodlak, and stole the fragments of Wuuthrad

quest.title: Purity of Revenge
quest.objective: avenge Kodlak
tasks: Go to Driftshade Refuge.
retrieve the fragments of Wuuthrad and wipe out the Silver Hand
avenge Kodlak
quest.description:
The Silver Hand attacked us. They finally found enough courage to attack Jorrvaskr. We fought them off, but... The old man... Kodlak... he's dead.
No one else got hurt, but they made off with all our fragments of Wuuthrad. But you and I are going to reclaim them. We will bring the battle to their chief camp, Driftshade Refuge. There will be none left living to tell their stories. Only songs of Jorrvaskr will be sung.
We will avenge Kodlak. And they will know terror before the end.

TL243: a temple swept by a plague that transforms priests into Nether-Thralls

plots: after saving the temple priests, the player can focus on aiding the Guardian of the Wild

quest.title: Sudden Outbreaks
quest.objective: save uninfected temple priests from Nether-Thralls

find the temple priests
save uninfected temple priests from Nether-Thralls
quest.description:
Thank the Gods you are here! A plague is sweeping through the Watchweald Temple, transforming the temple priests into Nether-Thralls! Several uninfected priests are still inside, trapped by the Nether-Thralls. I can protect them, if I can reach them... or if they can reach me.
Look for places where the temple priests may have hidden from the Nether-Thralls, and send them back here. Once they are all safe, we can focus on aiding the Guardian of the Wild.

TESO1: a Speaker for the Dark Brotherhood
TESO446: an inn on the Green Road to the north of Bravil
TESO447: an old and frail man who sleeps his days away
TESO448: the spiritual leader of the Dark Brotherhood, a woman

plots: Lucien Lachance has awoken the player from their sleep: the player is a murderer whose work pleases the Night Mother
Lucien Lachance gives the player a new blade

quest.title: A Knife in the Dark
quest.objective: complete your initiation to the Dark Brotherhood
tasks: Go to Inn of Ill Omen.
assassinate Rufio
complete your initiation to the Dark Brotherhood
quest.description:
You sleep rather soundly for a murderer. That's good. You'll need a clear conscience for what I'm about to propose.
I am Lucien Lachance, a Speaker for the Dark Brotherhood. And you, you are a killer. A taker of life. A harvester of souls. Your work, your deathcraft, pleases the Night Mother. And so, I come to you with an offering. An opportunity... to join our rather unique family.
On the Green Road to the north of Bravil lies the Inn of Ill Omen. There you will find a man named Rufio. Kill him, and your initiation into the Dark Brotherhood will be complete. Know that Rufio is old and weak, and sleeps his days away. You could kill him before he even has a chance to wake. If you so choose. Do this, and the next time you sleep in a location I deem secure, I will reveal myself once more, bearing the love of your new family.
Please accept this token from the Dark Brotherhood. It is a virgin blade, and thirsts for blood. May it serve you well, as does your silence.

TESO75: not a cave - a buried keep hosting Sir Berich's tomb

plots: the player is a holy knight
Sir Roderic is dead: he was questing for the holy Relics at the Prophet's call with Lathon

Sir Roderic prayed at all the shrines, and received a disturbing vision featuring Sir Berich: Sir Berich had found the Greaves of the Crusader and the Sword of the Crusader, but had then turned to evil
Sir Roderic found the Relics and the wraith of Sir Berich within Sir Berich's tomb: Sir Roderic shouted for Lathon to take the Greaves of the Crusader
Lathon gives the player the Greaves of the Crusader
the wraith of Sir Berich attacked Sir Roderic with the Sword of the Crusader

quest.title: The Sword of the Crusader
quest.objective: avenge Sir Roderic, and recover the Sword of the Crusader for yourself
tasks: Go to Underpall Cave.
find the the wraith of Sir Berich
avenge Sir Roderic, and recover the Sword of the Crusader for yourself
quest.description:
Sir knight! I have terrible news. Sir Roderic... I think he's dead.
Sir Roderic was a holy knight, like you, questing for the Relics at the Prophet's call. I, Lathon, was his squire. I believed he was chosen by the gods to reclaim the Relics. At first things were going well. He prayed at all the shrines, and received a vision. A disturbing vision. "The shade of Sir Berich spoke to me," was all he said. "We must put him to rest." He said that Sir Berich's tomb was in Underpall Cave -- which is no cave, but some kind of buried keep.
He had learned that Sir Berich had once been a questing knight, like us. He had found the Greaves and Sword of the Crusader, but then turned to evil. Sir Roderic hoped to find the Relics within Sir Berich's tomb. And he did. But we also found a terrible guardian -- the wraith of Sir Berich.
I brought you... Sir Roderic shouted for me to take them... the Greaves of the Crusader. The holy Relic. They're yours. The wraith used the Sword of the Crusader against Sir Roderic. I don't know how that evil thing could use the holy weapon, but it did.
You must avenge Sir Roderic by killing the foul wraith and get yourself the Sword of the Crusader!

plots: the player told Shum gro-Yarug that they want to buy a house
Rosethorn Hall is currently occupied by Vandorallen Trebatius
Shum gro-Yarug will have Vandorallen Trebatius evicted from Rosethorn Hall

quest.title: Buying a House in Skingrad
quest.objective: purchase Rosethorn Hall
tasks: give 25,000 septims to Shum gro-Yarug
purchase Rosethorn Hall
quest.description:
I'm Shum gro-Yarug, the Count's butler.
So you want to buy a house? I can speak for the Count. Rosethorn Hall is a stately manor currently occupied by Vandorallen Trebatius. You won't find a better property for sale in Skingrad. It's just inside the main gate, near the bridge to the chapel.
The house costs 25,000 septims. Give me the septims, and I will order the deed to the house drawn up.
Don't worry about Vandorallen Trebatius. I'll have him evicted. I'm sure he'll find another home easily.

TESO212: a looping dungeon that is used to get rid of unwanted people
TESO56: a man who employs Kiliban Nyrandil
TESO222: a manual that tells the player how Xedilian works, given to the player by Sheogorath

plots: Xedilian would normally have sent the player back to the entrance when they stepped on the pad in the Resonator Chamber: the player mus deal with the adventurers who are entering Xedilian before the player can leave Xedilian
the player should consult Kiliban Nyrandil or the Manual

quest.title: Baiting the Trap
quest.objective: get out of Xedilian
tasks: deal with the adventurers
get out of Xedilian
quest.description:
Welcome to Xedilian, I'm the dungeon caretaker, Kiliban Nyrandil.
Xedilian would normally have sent you back to the entrance when you stepped on the pad in the Resonator Chamber. Since you're up here, I can only surmise that adventurers are already entering the dungeon as we speak.
I'm afraid until the adventurers are dealt with, Xedilian will keep you here. Even I can't will its doors to open. To put it bluntly, you're stuck here for the moment. No disrespect intended.
The only thing we can do is let the adventurers complete a cycle through here. I'll be glad to help. I assume Sheogorath gave you the Manual. You can consult it for more information, or I can provide instructions.

TESO238: the player's superior in the Thieves Guild

TESO146: the leader of the Thieves Guild

We meet again. I have need of a very special book, the "Lost Histories of Tamriel".
The cat burglar Theranis was sent hunting in Skingrad for this book. However, Theranis has not been seen since. The Gray Fox himself hunts for this book.
I need you to find Theranis. Help Theranis bring back this book. If Theranis is unwilling or unable, bring back the book yourself.
Go to Skingrad. The trail starts there.

Maybe you can help me. I've heard there's a Beornen shaman or something out in the Path of the Honored Dead, who has the kind of enchanting tools I need. If you could locate this bear-mage and acquire those tools, I would happily give you your first enchantment, free of charge!

TESO282: Herminia Cinna's home, in the Imperial City, the Elven Gardens district
Herminia Cinna's home, in the Imperial City, the Elven Gardens district

plots: the player has obtained Ayleid artifacts for Umbacano before

quest.title: Secrets of the Ayleids
quest.objective: escort Umbacano to the Throne Room of Nenalata
tasks: Go to .
try to buy the Crown of Nenalata from Herminia Cinna
escort Umbacano to the Throne Room of Nenalata
quest.description:
I have another job for you. This is not quite in your usual line of work, but I hope you can help me just the same.
A rival collector has an item, the Crown of Nenalata, which I very much want to add to my collection. But she stubbornly refuses to consider any of my offers. She and I have had our differences over the years, I admit. Now she is taking this opportunity to get her revenge. I believe that you may be able to persuade her to part with the item, where I cannot due to her prejudice against me. Her name is Herminia Cinna. She lives here in the Imperial City, in the Elven Gardens district.
I hope you will succeed where I have so far failed. Afterwards, in order to bring my research on the last king of the Ayleids to its final stage, I need to go to the Throne Room of Nenalata. While I am not without means of defending myself, I believe you would be an invaluable companion on such an expedition. Your reward will be whatever plunder you wish to carry off from Nenalata. Since the Throne Room has been sealed since the time of the Ayleids, it should provide rich pickings.

TESS168: the player's guildleader in the Dark Brotherhood
TESS169: a famous master chef, whose true identity is not known

You'll kill him, steal his Writ of Passage, and assume the role of master chef. Festus has been spearheading this part of the assassination plan. He's close to uncovering the identity of the Gourmet.
You should report to him.

get training from Marana Rian

BG2195: the player's director producing the play

plots: the player is the patron of the playhouse

actors believe there is a curse assailing them

investigate the strange things that have occurred during the production of the play
quest.description:
You... would not believe what has been occurring. We are finally making progress in rehearsals, and now... other things are happening... We've had props inexplicably fall from tables! A cistern broke and ruined an entire backdrop! An actress slipped yesterday and almost broke her foot! There's been other strange things, too... noises during the night, creakings and moanings. One of the stagers almost died falling out of the rafters!
All the actors are frightened; they believe the curse is assailing us, and I... am beginning to believe it too. Oh, what a fool I was to disregard it!
You are the patron of the playhouse... I need you to talk to someone who has offered to help.

TESS552: the commander of the Redoran Guard

plots: the player saved Captain Veleth's life: his guardsman was killed by an ash spawn though

stop the ash spawn attacks on Raven Rock
quest.description:
Thanks... I wasn't sure I'd make it off this farm alive. I wish I could have said the same for my man here.
Some of the Redoran Guard have taken to calling them "ash spawn". Me? I don't care what they're called... all I know is they're a danger to Raven Rock and they need to be stopped.
I was going to search for clues that might lead me to wherever they're coming from. I know it isn't the best place to start, but we know they've been coming from this direction.
Could you lend me a hand? We were searching the farm when the ash spawn ambushed us. Have a look around and see if you can turn up anything useful.

plots: the Blades killed the dragons off centuries ago

quest.title: A Blade in the Dark

go to an ancient dragon burial with Delphine, and kill a dragon
help Delphine stop dragons from coming back to life
quest.description:
Dragons aren't just coming back, they're coming back to life. They weren't gone somewhere for all these years. They were dead, killed off centuries ago by my predecessors. Now something's happening to bring them back to life. And I need you to help me stop it.
I've visited their ancient burial mounds and found them empty. And I've figured out where the next one will come back to life. We're going to go there, and you're going to kill that dragon. If we succeed, I'll tell you anything you want to know.
We are going to Kynesgrove. There's an ancient dragon burial near there. If we can get there before the dragon comes back, maybe we'll learn how to stop it.

TESO337: a dangerous man, and the player's enemy

tasks: travel through Martin's portal to Mankar Camoran's Paradise
kill Mankar Camoran to unmake his Paradise, and retrieve the Amulet of Kings
quest.description:
I have everything in place for the ritual. I'll open the portal whenever you're ready. I don't know what you'll find in Camoran's Paradise. I do know the portal I create through the Mysterium Xarxes ritual will close behind you. You'll have to find another way back.
I believe that Mankar Camoran acts as the "anchor" for Paradise, just as a sigil stone anchors an Oblivion Gate in place. Kill Mankar Camoran, and you will unmake his Paradise.
Farewell, my friend. Our fate is in your hands. Bring back the Amulet of Kings. Brace yourself.

help Talvas Fathryon by killing an Ash Guardian
quest.description:
You've got to help me! I conjured an Ash Guardian and now it's running amok in Tel Mithryn.
Master Neloth refused to teach me the Ash Guardian spell. So I read his spell book on my own and learned it. Something went wrong when I cast it. The creature is attacking everything in sight.
I need to keep Master Neloth distracted so he doesn't find out what I did. There is no telling what he would do to me. While you are taking care of the creature, I'll try to figure out what went wrong.
I don't have any gold to pay you with, but I can give you this staff.

TESS11: a province half a continent away from the player and Serana
TESS9: mysterious scrolls used in divining prophecies

plots: Serana has a large Elder Scroll on her back: Serana's Elder Scroll will have something that can help the player and Serana stop Serana's father
the moth priests of Cyrodiil are the only people who can read Elder Scrolls

quest.title: Prophet
quest.objective: find a way to read Serana's Elder Scroll
tasks: Go to College of Winterhold.
ask the wizards about reading Elder Scrolls
find a way to read Serana's Elder Scroll
quest.description:
So, in case you didn't notice the giant thing on my back, I have an Elder Scroll with me. Whatever it says, it will have something that can help us stop my father. But of course, neither of us can read it.
The Moth Priests are the only ones I've heard of who can do it. They spend years preparing before they start reading, though. Not that it helps us anyway, because they're all half a continent away in Cyrodiil.
The College of Winterhold was the first place I'd think to go for any kind of magic or historical thing. The wizards there know about all kinds of things that people probably shouldn't know about.
